column4: Does anyone can recommend me a good app for making screenshots under Ubuntu? I'm using XFCE
there are some command line ones like scrot, xfce probably has its own screenshot util though
What is the name of the tool you just mentioned?
FMW it's the default window manager in XFCE
i was just pointing out that gnome doesn't run a daemon for that sort of stuff
I'm installing scrot now...just eager to see what happens
Sorry, but it doesn't work look --> johny@johny-laptop:~/Desktop$ scrot -d 5 -c operaTaking shot in 5.. 4.. 3.. 2.. 1.. 0.
weird, i just noticed that too... are you running gutsy? it must be a regression
well i'm going to file a bug on it, i'm not sure what other programs there are... maybe you should ask in the xfce channel to see what they are using

So, the output format must be specified
